CONJUGATES: Noun: slats (plural) | Verb: slats (3rd person singular present) | slatted (past tense, past participle) | slatting (present participle)
ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English, of uncertain Germanic origin; the noun (thin strip) may be related to Middle Low German 'slatte' (a stripe); the verb (to strike) may be related to Old Norse 'slathra' (to strike, beat).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A thin, flat strip of wood, metal, or other rigid material, often one of a series.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 木头、金属或其他硬质材料制成的薄而扁平的条状物，通常为系列中的一条。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The bed frame was supported by several wooden slats.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 床架由几根木板条支撑着。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Transitive verb; a verb that takes one or more objects.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To equip or furnish something with slats.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 给某物安装板条；用板条固定。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: They decided to slat the new fence rather than using solid panels.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他们决定给新围栏安装板条而不是使用实心板。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Transitive verb; a verb that takes one or more objects. | Intransitive verb; a verb that does not take a direct object.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To strike or throw something with force; to dash or beat.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 猛击或猛扔某物；猛冲或猛打。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The rain slatted against the windows during the storm.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 暴风雨中，雨点猛烈地敲打着窗户。
